homePage.testimonial3Quote: I was hesitant about therapy, but Faye's warmth and expertise made all the difference. I highly recommend her!
homePage.testimonial4Quote: Faye's guidance helped me navigate a difficult life transition. Her compassionate approach was invaluable!

aboutFaye.title: Meet Faye Youker
aboutFaye.imageAlt: Faye Youker in a professional and welcoming setting
aboutFaye.intro1: With a deep commitment to fostering mental wellness, I provide a supportive and non-judgmental space for individuals and couples to explore challenges, gain insights, and develop effective coping strategies.
aboutFaye.intro2: My approach is collaborative and tailored to your unique needs, drawing from evidence-based practices to help you achieve your therapeutic goals and enhance your overall well-being.

whyChoose.title: Why Choose Therapy With Me?
whyChoose.item1Desc: Therapy tailored to your unique needs and goals, ensuring a relevant and effective experience.
whyChoose.item2Desc: A confidential and non-judgmental space where you can feel secure and understood.
whyChoose.item3Desc: Utilizing proven therapeutic techniques to help you achieve lasting positive change.

servicesPage.title: Therapeutic Services
servicesPage.intro: Offering a range of specialized therapy services designed to support your journey towards emotional well-being and personal growth. Whether you're seeking individual support or looking to strengthen your relationship, I'm here to help.
servicesPage.anxietyDesc: Tools and support for managing anxiety, panic, and chronic stress.
servicesPage.anxietyImageAlt: Woman meditating calmly on a sofa, representing anxiety and stress management
servicesPage.traumaDesc: Healing from past traumatic experiences in a safe, supportive space.
servicesPage.traumaImageAlt: Person holding chest with shattered glass effect, symbolizing trauma recovery
servicesPage.depressionDesc: Compassionate care for navigating depression and improving mood.
servicesPage.depressionImageAlt: Two people in a therapy session, representing depression support
servicesPage.lgbtqDesc: Supportive therapy for LGBTQIA+ individuals and couples.
servicesPage.lgbtqImageAlt: Two diverse individuals in a supportive therapy session with pride flag elements, for LGBTQIA+ affirming therapy
servicesPage.couplesDesc: Strengthening relationships, improving communication, and resolving conflict.
servicesPage.couplesImageAlt: Couple in a therapy session with a therapist, representing couples counseling
servicesPage.womensIssuesDesc: Addressing unique challenges and experiences faced by women.
servicesPage.womensIssuesImageAlt: Two women in a supportive conversation, representing women's issues therapy
servicesPage.lifeTransitionsDesc: Guidance through major life changes, career shifts, and personal growth.
servicesPage.lifeTransitionsImageAlt: Person standing at a crossroads, symbolizing life transitions
servicesPage.flexibleApproach: My approach is flexible and tailored to your unique needs. We will work together to find the best path forward for you.

aboutApproachPage.fullTextP1: Welcome! I'm Faye Youker, a Licensed Master Social Worker (LMSW) in Michigan and a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) in Michigan. My passion lies in helping adults and couples navigate life's complexities and find paths towards healing, growth, and more fulfilling relationships.
aboutApproachPage.fullTextP2: I believe that everyone possesses the innate capacity for change and resilience. My role as a therapist is to provide a safe, empathetic, and collaborative space where you can explore your inner world, understand your patterns, and develop the skills and insights needed to overcome challenges.
aboutApproachPage.fullTextP3: My therapeutic approach is integrative, drawing from various evidence-based modalities including Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR), and Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT), especially when working with couples. This allows me to tailor our sessions to your specific needs and preferences.
aboutApproachPage.fullTextP4: I am committed to creating a non-judgmental environment where you feel heard, understood, and empowered. Together, we will work towards your goals, whether they involve managing anxiety or depression, healing from trauma, improving self-esteem, or strengthening your relationships.
aboutApproachPage.fayeImage2Alt: Faye Youker in a professional setting
aboutApproachPage.fayeImage3Alt: Faye Youker during a therapy session
aboutApproachPage.philosophyText: My philosophy is rooted in the belief that a strong therapeutic alliance is the foundation for meaningful change. I strive to build a relationship based on trust, respect, and collaboration. I view therapy as a partnership where we work together to uncover your strengths, address your challenges, and help you build a life that aligns with your values. I am dedicated to providing culturally sensitive and affirming care to individuals from all backgrounds.
aboutApproachPage.quoteText: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.
aboutApproachPage.officeText: Designed to be a sanctuary for healing and reflection, my office provides a calm, comfortable, and confidential setting for our sessions. It's a space where you can feel at ease to explore your thoughts and emotions freely. I offer both in-person sessions at my conveniently located office and secure teletherapy sessions for those who prefer or require remote access.
aboutApproachPage.officeImage1Alt: Comfortable chair in a serene therapy room
aboutApproachPage.officeImage2Alt: Calming artwork and plants in the therapy office

aboutApproachPage.accessibilityInfo: My office is wheelchair accessible and located with ample parking. For teletherapy, I use a secure, HIPAA-compliant platform.

credentialsPage.title: My Credentials & Qualifications
credentialsPage.training2: Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT) Externship & Core Skills
credentialsPage.membership3: International Centre for Excellence in Emotionally Focused Therapy (ICEEFT)

clientFocusPage.title: Who I Help
clientFocusPage.intro: I specialize in providing therapy for adults and couples facing a variety of life's challenges. My goal is to create a supportive and understanding environment where you can explore your concerns and work towards positive change.
clientFocusPage.adultsDesc: I work with individual adults dealing with issues such as:
clientFocusPage.adultIssue1: Anxiety disorders (generalized anxiety, social anxiety, panic attacks)
clientFocusPage.adultIssue6: Life transitions (career changes, grief, relationship endings)
clientFocusPage.couplesDesc: I help couples navigate challenges and strengthen their bond, including:
clientFocusPage.diversityDesc: I am committed to providing culturally sensitive and affirming therapy to individuals from all backgrounds, including all races, ethnicities, sexual orientations, gender identities, religions, and abilities. Your unique experiences are valued and respected in our therapeutic work.
clientFocusPage.notSureTitle: Not Sure If It's a Fit?
clientFocusPage.notSureDesc: If you're unsure whether my services are right for you, I encourage you to schedule a 15-minute consultation. This is a great opportunity to discuss your needs, ask questions, and see if we're a good match.

treatmentMethodsPage.title: My Therapeutic Approaches
treatmentMethodsPage.intro: I utilize a variety of evidence-based therapeutic methods, tailoring my approach to best suit your individual needs and goals. My aim is to provide effective, compassionate, and personalized care.
treatmentMethodsPage.method1Desc: CBT helps you identify and change negative thought patterns and behaviors that contribute to emotional distress. It's effective for anxiety, depression, and more.
treatmentMethodsPage.method2Desc: DBT focuses on developing skills in mindfulness, distress tolerance, emotion regulation, and interpersonal effectiveness. Particularly helpful for intense emotions and relationship difficulties.
treatmentMethodsPage.method3Desc: Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) is a powerful therapy for processing traumatic memories and reducing their emotional impact.
treatmentMethodsPage.method4Desc: Primarily used with couples, EFT helps to identify and change negative interactional patterns, fostering secure attachment and deeper emotional connection.
treatmentMethodsPage.method5Desc: Incorporating mindfulness practices to increase self-awareness, reduce stress, and cultivate a greater sense of presence and calm.
treatmentMethodsPage.method6Desc: Drawing from various approaches and always prioritizing your unique experiences, strengths, and goals to create a truly personalized therapeutic journey.
treatmentMethodsPage.collaborativeProcess: Our work together is a collaborative process. We'll discuss which approaches might be most beneficial for you and adjust as needed throughout our journey.

feesPage.title: Fees & Insurance
feesPage.intro: Understanding the financial aspect of therapy is important. Below you'll find information on session rates and accepted insurance plans. I strive to make therapy accessible and can discuss options with you.
feesPage.freeConsultationInfo: I offer a 15-minute phone consultation for new clients to discuss your needs and see if we're a good fit.
feesPage.paymentDesc: Payment is due at the time of service. I accept major credit cards, HSA/FSA cards, cash, and checks.
feesPage.insuranceDesc: I am in-network with the following insurance plans. Please verify your coverage and benefits (copay, deductible, session limits) with your insurance provider prior to our first session. If I am not in-network with your insurance, I can provide you with a superbill (a detailed receipt) that you can submit to your insurance company for potential reimbursement, depending on your out-of-network benefits. I also accept all car insurances.
feesPage.insuranceInfoP1: I am in-network with the following insurance plans. Please verify your coverage and benefits (copay, deductible, session limits) with your insurance provider prior to our first session.
feesPage.insuranceInfoP2: If I am not in-network with your insurance, I can provide you with a superbill (a detailed receipt) that you can submit to your insurance company for potential reimbursement, depending on your out-of-network benefits.
feesPage.insuranceOutOfNetworkDesc: If I am not in-network with your insurance, I can provide you with a superbill (a detailed receipt) that you can submit to your insurance company for potential reimbursement, depending on your out-of-network benefits.
feesPage.cancellationDesc: Please provide at least 24 hours notice if you need to cancel or reschedule your appointment. Late cancellations or missed appointments will be charged the full session fee.
feesPage.goodFaithDescP1: Under Section 2799B-6 of the Public Health Service Act, health care providers and health care facilities are required to inform individuals who are not enrolled in a plan or coverage or a Federal health care program, or not seeking to file a claim with their plan or coverage both orally and in writing of their ability, upon request or at the time of scheduling health care items and services, to receive a “Good Faith Estimate” of expected charges.
feesPage.goodFaithDescP2: You have the right to receive a Good Faith Estimate for the total expected cost of any non-emergency items or services. This includes related costs like medical tests, prescription drugs, equipment, and hospital fees.
feesPage.goodFaithDescP3: Make sure your health care provider gives you a Good Faith Estimate in writing at least 1 business day before your medical service or item. You can also ask your health care provider, and any other provider you choose, for a Good Faith Estimate before you schedule an item or service.
feesPage.goodFaithDescP4: If you receive a bill that is at least $400 more than your Good Faith Estimate, you can dispute the bill. Make sure to save a copy or picture of your GoodFaith Estimate.
feesPage.goodFaithDescP5: For questions or more information about your right to a Good Faith Estimate, visit www.cms.gov/nosurprises or call 1-800-985-3059.
feesPage.verifyButton: Please verify your insurance coverage prior to your first session.

faqList.question: What are your session fees?
faqList.answer: Individual therapy sessions (50 minutes) are $150. Couples therapy sessions (50 minutes) are $175.

faqList.question: Do you offer a sliding scale?
faqList.answer: I have a limited number of sliding scale slots available based on financial need. Please inquire during your consultation.

faqList.question: What forms of payment do you accept?
faqList.answer: I accept major credit cards, HSA/FSA cards, cash, and checks.

faqList.question: How do I use my out-of-network benefits?
faqList.answer: If I am out-of-network with your insurance, I can provide a superbill (detailed receipt) for you to submit to your insurance for potential reimbursement. It's best to check with your provider about your specific out-of-network benefits.

faqList.question: What is your cancellation policy?
faqList.answer: Please provide at least 24 hours notice if you need to cancel or reschedule. Late cancellations or missed appointments are charged the full session fee.

feesPage.noFaqAvailable: Frequently asked questions will be available soon.

contactPage.title: Get in Touch
contactPage.intro: Ready to take the next step or have questions? I'm here to help. Please reach out using the form below or contact me directly. I aim to respond to all inquiries within 24-48 business hours.
contactPage.formMessagePlaceholder: Tell me a bit about what you're looking for...
contactPage.formSuccessToastDesc: Thank you for reaching out. I'll be in touch soon.
contactPage.formErrorToastDesc: Please try again or contact me directly.

contactPage.emergencyDesc: If you are experiencing a mental health crisis or emergency, please call 911 or go to your nearest emergency room. You can also contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 988.
contactPage.mapAlt: Map showing office location of Faye Youker Therapy in Traverse City

contactPage.scheduleConsultationText: Need assistance or ready to start? Let's connect.
contactPage.privacyNote: Please note that email is not a secure form of communication. Please do not include sensitive clinical information in your email. For urgent matters, please call.
